item.title: Finding classical deaths and revivals, like in the atom-field interaction?
item.description: Maybe it’s a tricky question to put a link between the diametrical phenomenology of classical and quantum mechanics; but, for the most of the history, we use the first as an archetype to extend the comprehension of the second. Working around a superb-classical system like a set of \(N\) coupled harmonic oscillators $$\ddot{q_{i}}(t) = -(k_{i} + k_{i+1})q_{i}(t) + k_{i+1}q_{i+1}(t) + k_{i}q_{i-1}(t),$$ we can solve the set of equation with a plethora of methods developed in the last centuries.

About me Hey, you! So you want to know a little about me, well this is a short story because my work represents me. Currently, I’m an early researcher on Theoretical Physics signed at the Optics Coordination of the National Institute of Astrophysics, Optics and Electronics (INAOE in Spanish, for short). My educational path Bachelor of Science in Physics \(\longrightarrow \) Master of Science in Physics \(\longrightarrow \) PhD in Optics
